item.title: Associate - Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate - Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Data Analytics you will work closely with business and technology teams across Wealth Management Europe (WME) to support the ongoing maintenance of the Data Analytics infrastructure and with the delivery of analytical insights to business.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Support the design, development and ongoing maintenance of the scalable Data Analytics data infrastructure using the Microsoft SQL technology stack to serve as the foundational layer for analytics and insights, support and guide team on technical design and implementations
  • Identify, source, stage and model data using industry standard technologies and established development and operational practices as part of the end-to-end data lifecycle
  • Work with the business and senior team members to identify and source data points across core platforms and processes for inclusion within the Data Analytics data repository
  • Ability to structure large disparate data sets to serve multiple functions and tailor the results for specific audiences, supporting the creation of model development to support investigation and analysis
  • Ability to create new and modify existing T-SQL scripts, stored procedures and SSIS packages to support new and regular reporting requirements
  • Research, explore and understand business problems and reporting requirements and support in the design, development and deployment of solutions and dashboards, enabling end-user self-service, incorporating drill-down functionality
  • Provide data driven and thought provoking insights to drive informed decision-making, supporting the transfer of knowledge to stakeholders to use its data more effectively
  • Adhere to the established DevOps’s process to ensure that new or changes to existing source code or DB structure follow the agreed development and release processes and that all productionised code is adequately documented and reviewed

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Experience with MS SQL Server, Data Warehousing techniques, solutions and methodologies
  • Good understanding of relational database principals
  • Good knowledge of SQL, working with ETL\'s and SSIS packages
  • Data management analyst with ability to mine and visualize data
  • Good understanding of datasets, data warehouses /modelling, database design and programming

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of Tableau
  • Experience with JIRA
  • Experience with GitHub
  • Knowledge of Agile project management principles

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible and hybrid working options fully supported

Job Summary

Address:

Saint Helier, Jersey

City:

GBR-GREATER_LONDON-LONDON, JEY-ST_HELIER-SAINT HELIER

Country:

Jersey

Work hours/week:

36.25

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-20

Application Deadline:

2023-07-14

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: 2023 CAE Group, Fall Data Analytics Co-op (4 Months)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 CAE Group, Fall Data Analytics Co-op (4 Months)

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Performing research and providing answers for auditors.

  • Building foundational, advanced and predictive analytics.

  • External research on open source code available to tackle existing data problems.

  • Developing product or service knowledge and competence in tools and business processes used in the department.

    Must have

  • Pursuing a degree in computer science or engineering

  • Knowledge of python and R

  • Basic understanding of data science concepts

    Nice to have

  • Knowledge of Data IKU

  • Knowledge of Tableau

Job Summary

Participates and supports data related projects and assignments. Responsible for delivery and ownership of data analytics throughout the audit lifecycle.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Student/Coop (Fixed Term)

item.title: Manager ,Data Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager ,Data Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability. The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

This role will be responsible for for the effective and efficient management of the team (GSMF GSP DMUK & DSD AU), ensuring that all services are rendered in an accurate and timely manner Including heavily client on boarding aspects when necessary (client documentation, client communications, new processes, SOL/SLA…) and activity follow-up cross locations with other DSD centers in collaboration with functional leaders.

You will be supporting Europe (LUX/UK) business, working on shift hours of  4:00pm – 1:00am or 3:00pm  - 12:00am.

What will you do?

  • Accountable for the cross location collaboration (Other DSD centers ) to ensure contingency support as well as consistency in procedures and delivery
  • Accountable for procedures validation and implementation including cross location aspects under the authority of the functional senior management.
  • Accountable for KPI information submission and follow-up to ensure best allocation of resources in term of efficiency, timeliness and quality ratio.
  • Promote quality of deliverables and client service by motivating, coaching and developing team members.
  • Identify and share development and training needs, design training plan for the year.
  • Accountable for the appraisal process (set clear annual business objectives and review them mid-year), absence tracking
  • Responsible for identifying areas where efficiencies and accuracy improvements can be made and implement a plan of action.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Knowledge of different investment instrument types
  • People management skills
  • Securities operations experience
  • Willing to work on local MY holidays and follow Europe holidays
  • Flexibility in working hours/ shifts in Europe time zone.

Nice-to-have

  • Flexibility in working hours.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-16

Application Deadline:

2023-07-05

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Supervisor, Data Service Delivery
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Supervisor, Data Service Delivery

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability. The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

This role will be responsible for day to day processing of Portfolio Securities Valuation for Fund Administered under various platforms (12 Entities of the Group) Including: CPS Pricing L1/L2 – FX & Interest Rates L1/L2 – Stale Price Analysis L1 – Customer Support L1/L2 – EUCs Update and Daily Maintenance L1/L2 – CPS Parameterization L3 (Day to Day) – (*L1:Maker / L2: Reviewer / L3: Super User Access)

You will be supporting Europe (LUX/UK) business, working on shift hours of  4:00pm – 1:00am.

What will you do?

  • Promote quality of deliverables by motivating, coaching and developing team members
  • Ensure cross training and rotation of duties occurs on a regular basis to increase operational efficiency and reduce operational risk
  • Ensure all operational issues are treated in a timely and effective manner
  • Maintain an in depth knowledge of BCP procedures, policies and plans
  • Ensure compliance with and completion of code of conduct / RBC I&TS compliance manual / control self-assessment
  • Provide and maintain indicators to the management (KPI / KQI)
  • Ensure effective logging and resolution of enquiries and liaise with appropriate parties to resolve / escalate queries / problems within agreed timescales in coordination with the Global Securities Pricing Expertise Center (LUX)

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Sound technical and financial knowledge on reference data
  • Knowledge of different investment instrument types
  • Willing to work on local MY holidays and follow Europe holidays
  • Flexibility in working hours/ shifts in Europe time zone.

Nice-to-have

  • Flexibility in working hours.
  • Experience in Excel VBA.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-20

Application Deadline:

2023-07-07

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Supervisor, Static Data DSD (6 months contract)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Supervisor, Static Data DSD (6 months contract)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones.  Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations.  The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability.  The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally.

Reporting to the Manager, Data Management team, you will be responsible for the timely and accurate update and maintenance of all static data in Milvus. Setups would include opening, amendment & closing accounts/ static data in Milvus.

You will be supporting Global business with 8 working hours a day.

Shift hours would be between 3:00pm to 12:00am.

What will you do?

  • Setup and maintain all accounts required by the business in Milvus, K+, K+ TP, RBC Mainframe. Business would include BANK, TRUST, DSD Toronto and etc.
  • Act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the team, who would be able to provide advice and coaching, as well as delivers the output to others, generally at a more senior level, who make final decisions and take action or manage implementation.
  • To maintain all static data on Milvus accurately and within timeframes.
  • Strict adherence to clients\' service level agreements (SLA) and RBC Policy and Procedure Library (PPL).
  • Actively support an environment of continuous improvement and change management that covers workflow, processes and procedures on an ongoing basis, ensuring maximum efficiency and quality.
  • Constant changes in the regulatory environment that impact the operations, to mitigate financial/reputational risk by ensuring controls are reviewed and maintained in compliance with regulatory requirements or company policies.



What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Familiar with core platforms: Milvus.
  • Knowledge in Bloomberg and CAPS will be an added advantage.
  • Competent in MS office.
  • Banking experience in operations with basic static data knowledge.

Nice-to-have

  • Possess strong leadership and coaching skills.
  • Willingness to take on new challenges, confident and self-motivated

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including performance based bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • A collaborative dynamic culture where personal initiative and hard work are recognized and rewarded

Job Summary

Address:

Cyberjaya, Selangor, Malaysia

City:

MYS-SELANGOR-CYBERJAYA

Country:

Malaysia

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Contract (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2023-06-12

Application Deadline:

2023-06-29

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Manager, Program Governance
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Program Governance

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Manager, Program Governance, you will support the delivery of analytical insights for Global Finance IT and build interactive and intuitive dashboards to model data. This role will also be responsible for the oversight of project management tools to ensure appropriate IT cost recovery to various lines of businesses. You will report on various key performance indicators to Senior Management related to financial health and resource capacity trends. In addition, you will work intimately with project managers to leverage best practices on project expenditure management.

What will you do?

  • Provide administration for Finance IT’s project management tools (Planview/MIS) for Finance IT’s development and maintenance portfolio of $100mm+, including the creation/upkeep/closure of projects, population of key data attributes, and ensuring proper cost recovery of all IT personnel
  • Support project managers and delivery leads in administering project management tools and managing all aspects of financials (monitoring of actuals vs plan, forecasting, processing of invoices)
  • Reconcile contractor cost recoveries in Planview/MIS to professional fee accrual during month-end at the contract and resource level
  • Support executive and portfolio level financial/KPI reporting
  • Automate existing reporting and enhance data visualization/analytics through various productivity tools (Tableau, VBA, etc); develop new automated solutions to improve productivity and efficiency
  • Maintain a healthy, accurate financial control environment within the Finance IT Business Management Office, reinforcing our role as the source of financial truth (App Dev, Maintenance, 3rd Party, NIE, etc)
  • Monitoring and communicating key performance metrics and operational challenges
  • Implement change management as required for new implementations and enhancements for project management tools

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree, with a focus in finance, accounting, computer science, business or mathematics.
  • Experience in a financial control environment
  • Data analytics and reporting experience on large data sets and multiple sources
  • Advanced command of Microsoft Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and data visualization tools
  • Basic financial services and accounting knowledge

Nice-to-have

Notes:

  • Previous experience with Tableau, SQL, Planview
  • Experience in an IT delivery team with a focus on project management, and the systems development lifecycle
  • CPA, PMP, MBA designation(s)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities          
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
  • #LI-HYBRID
  • #LI-POST

item.title: Trainee Administrator/Administrator , Data Management & Quality
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trainee Administrator/Administrator , Data Management & Quality

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working as part of the back office Data Management & Quality team, checking and inputting changes to client information (such as changes in address, contact details or closures) and product information (such as a new bank account). You will learn about our applications and their impact on regulatory reporting and assist with standardisation projects. Knowledge of Know Your Client Documentation and the financial environment is advantageous but not essential.

UKJERSEYWM

What will you do?

  • Ensure the integrity of data across and between multiple systems is maintained

  • Complete data maintenance and supporting administrative tasks throughout the Client and Product lifecycle

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure that all issues, queries and obstacles are satisfactorily resolved to ensure that tasks are completed in a timely and efficient manner

  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of an appropriate control environment in line with applicable data standards, regulatory requirements and business unit procedures

  • Contribute to the ongoing efficiency, innovations, process review and development of Data Management and Quality

  • Act as an SME to assist with Optimisation activities including the development of new RPA processes, Service Requests and core application development

  • Assist in the rotation and remediation of daily control reports and collation of task information for Management Information

  • Assist with the delivery and completion of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Post Implementation Verification (PIV) testing


What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Strong communication, influencing and negotiating skills

  • Collaborative and consultative approach along with team player attitude

  • Ability to make decisions, use initiative and escalate issues

  • Ability to execute tasks within defined service level agreements

  • A proven track record in excellent service delivery

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

  • Ability and willingness to work from home in line with the hybrid working team charter


Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge/experience with Client Due Diligence (CDD) / Know Your Client (KYC) and supporting documentation

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible working options fully supported

Job Summary

Address:

Saint Helier, Jersey

City:

JEY-ST_HELIER-SAINT HELIER

Country:

Jersey

36.25

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

item.title: Fall 2023 Student - Associate - Term Investments & Savings
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Fall 2023 Student - Associate - Term Investments & Savings

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The opportunity is to be a part of the Term Investments & Savings product team, where you will assist in various product management duties related to our retail Guaranteed Investments Certificates (GICs) product suite as well as our retail Savings product suite.

What will you do?

  • Provide administrative support for various tasks related to product innovation, product strategy, portfolio analysis, and production issues (if any) related to the GICs and Savings product suite
  • Work with cross-functional partners to address client complaints and escalations related to GICs and Savings products
  • Assist with the update of relevant policies and procedures related to new products and/or system/procedural enhancements

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work with ambiguity
  • Attention-to-detail
  • Effective time-management and ability to manage competing demands
  • Comfort with Microsoft Office Suite (emphasis on Excel and Powerpoint)
  • Strong communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Basic knowledge about GICs and Savings
  • Basic Modelling skills
  • Presentation skills

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

Participates in and supports the operational activities of a business unit. Applies experience and complete working knowledge of the job and policies/practices to perform a combination of routine tasks and varied administrative/operational assignments.
